results.title: Om and Prom from Cambodia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “My Friends”.
A day in the life of two Cambodian boys. Shows them at school, at play, at home and working in the rice fields. They ride on elephants to the ruins of Angkor where they see the age-old ritual of the beautiful palace dancers.

group_siblings.title: Kyomi from Japan
My friend Hans from Germany

results.title: My friend Hans from Germany
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “My Friend”.
Tells something of the life of Hans, a German boy living in the village of Garmisch-Partenkirchen near Munich in Bavaria. Shows the harvest season and the unusual tradition of sheltering cattle under houses. Throughout the year Hans goes skiing on the nearby Zugspitz Mountain.

Om and Prom from Cambodia

results.title: Kyomi from Japan
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “My Friend”.
The story of Kyomi and her dream of becoming an “Ama” girl. Shows Japanese girls diving for oysters on the Mikimoto farm. When the nucleus is inserted the oysters are placed in wire cages and returned to the water on suspended rafts. They are lifted and cleaned several times before the pearls are harvested. Shows grading, weighing and stringing in the factory.

group_works.title: The Genetic chance
group_works.creator_credit: Robert Reid and British Broadcasting Corporation

results.title: The Genetic chance
results.creator_credit: Robert Reid and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “My Children My Children”.
Examines the moral and social implications of determining genetic disorders in unborn infants, and looks at the effects of a number of such disorders. Most of the discussion is centred around haemophilia.

Vaughan Williams: a London symphony - Scherzo (Nocturne) (3rd Movement)

results.title: Vaughan Williams: a London symphony - Scherzo (Nocturne) (3rd Movement)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Music in Motion”
The sights, sounds and feelings of London at night aptly illustrate the third movement of Vaughan Williams’ London Symphony. The fountain at Marble Arch, pigeons in Trafalgar Square, moving traffic, flickering neon signs, a Cockney blowing on a mouth-organ, are contrasted with the dignity and tradition of the House of Parliament, and the evening mist and sunset along the Thames Embankment. Includes a Study Guide.

results.title: Mozart: Symphony No. 41 in C Major, Menuetto Allegretto (3rd Movement)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Music in Motion Series”.
A series of abstrzct scenes of nature in a variety of rhythms, moods and tempos give added significance to the music in Mozart’s Minuet from the “Jupiter” Symphony.

results.title: Moussorgsky: 'Pictures at an exhibition'
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Music in Motion”.
Scenes of the flower gardens at Paris’ Louvre and Tuileries Park, children playing, fluffy chicks running about, the bustling market place at Limoges and the Paris Catacombs are shown to express part of Moussorgsky’s composition “Pictures at an Exhibition”. The composer wrote the music to pay homage to paintings by his friend Victor Hartmann.

results.title: Beethoven, Symphony No. 8 in F Major (Tempo Di Minueto -3rd
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Music in Motion”.
Beethoven often found his musical motives and themes in scenes of nature; scenes of the peacefully flowing Rhine river, ruined castles, leaves turning in the sun, an open field of grain express the charm and individuality of this movement of Beethoven’s Eight Symphony. No other credits are available.
